Module org.freeinternals.formatclass

Package org.freeinternals.format.classfile

Parse a Java class file Byte Array, and provides a serious of friendly classes to get information from the parsed class file.

Package Specification

We start to use this package by constructing a ClassFile object from a byte java class byte array: 
    byte[] classByteArray = ...
    ClassFile classfile = new ClassFile(classByteArray)
and then, we can get various information from the class file: 
    String modifiers = classfile.getModifiers();
    cp_info[] cp = classfile.constant_pool;
    u2 fieldsCount = classfile.fields_count.value;
    field_info[] fields = classfile.field_info;
    u2 methodsCount = classfile.methods_count.value;
    method_info[] methods = classfile.methods;
    ...

Related Documentation

For overviews, tutorials, examples, guides, and tool documentation, please see:
  • https://github.com/amosshi/freeinternals
  • Java Language and Virtual Machine Specifications
Author:
Amos Shi

ClassFile
  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    GenerateTreeNodeClassFile
    Interface for generating tree node for ClassFile.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    ClassFile
    Represents a class file.
    field_info
    Field of a class or interface.
    JavaLangSpec
    Java Language specification constants.
    JTreeClassFile
    A tree for ClassFile displaying all components in the class file.
    method_info
    Method of a class or interface.
    Opcode
    Opcode parser to interpret the Java code byte array into human readable text.
    Opcode.InstructionParsed
    Parsed result for each opcode instruction.
    Opcode.lookupswitch
    Instruction structure used by Opcode.Instruction.lookupswitch.
    Opcode.tableswitch
    Instruction structure used by Opcode.Instruction.tableswitch.
    SignatureConvertor
    Convert the Internal Form of Names into java language specification type names.
    SignatureConvertor.SignatureResult
    Signature parse result.
    u1
    An unsigned one-byte quantity.
    u2
    An unsigned two-byte quantity.
    U2ClassComponent
    Super class for all simple components which have only one 16-bit (u2) field in a class file.
    u4
    An unsigned four-byte quantity.
  • Enum Summary 
    Enum Description
    AccessFlag
    Access flags are mask of flags used to denote access permissions to and properties of this class file.
    ClassFile.FormatVersion
    Class file Format Version numbers.
    JavaLangSpec.Keyword
    50 character sequences, formed from ASCII letters, are reserved for use as keywords and cannot be used as identifiers.
    JavaLangSpec.RestrictedIdentifier
    The identifiers var and yield are restricted identifiers because they are not allowed in some contexts.
    JavaLangSpec.RestrictedKeyword
    A further ten character sequences are restricted keywords: open, module, requires, transitive, exports, opens, to, uses, provides, and with.
    JavaSEVersion
    Java SE platform version.
    Opcode.Instruction
    The Java Virtual Machine Instruction Set.
    Opcode.NewarrayType
    Data types used by Opcode.Instruction.newarray.
